title: Charles-Tim
author: Charles-Tim
created_time: September 16, 2023, 04:35:49 PMLast edit: September 16, 2023, 11:25:23 PM by Charles-Tim
content: See this as a question.This business account company is new, make more research about it yourself.On Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.swwipe.appIt is a business accountYou do not have to register the account name with your name, you can use any name that you likeFor another bank to transfer cash to which is your bank, Opay, Kuda and Palmpay are not listedOnly commerical banks like First bank, GTbank that are listedSaid it is licensed by the Centralized Bank of Nigeria (CBN)The last time I tried Chipper cash and other means bitcoin and other crypto P2P users can accept naira payment, I always see my name displayed if I want to send to myself. But with Swwipe, it is only the name that you used that will be displayed, not your real name.I noticed on Nigeria local board that we do not like P2P. This might be because of privacy. Is this app worth using?You can read more about it yourself. It is created for business and it has more features than what I have explained about it. Is it worth it? It is new so I will only advise people to try it with small amount of money. What do you think?

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: If they are registered with CBN does that mean that CBN have started approving companies offering crypto-related services? It will be good anyway but then one have to do more research about the company.  If it happens that they are actually approved by CBN, then Bitcoin penetration in Nigeria is about to take a new shift and that is a wonderful news for us.

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-TimIt is new so I will not advise people to try it with small amount of money. What do you think?Thanks for this new update bro, i will do personal research to know more about this new app because most of the exchange app always demand for BVN for registration which is my fear for any new app that is asking for BVN before the process will be successful because, we all no that anybody can use your BVN to gain access to your money at anytime without your permission. Since you have advise us to try it with small amount of money, if the registration is successful and the app is good to our taste before thinking of how to save some huge amount of money for future use. I believe this app will be more secure than OPay, kuda, and palmpay because, many people has loss a lot of money to all those new online app that made people to prefer banks than online banking because if you have seriou issues you can run to the bank for their customercare to solve it for you instantly.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Odohu on September 16, 2023, 05:16:35 PMIf they are registered with CBN does that mean that CBN have started approving companies offering crypto-related services? It will be good anyway but then one have to do more research about the company.  If it happens that they are actually approved by CBN, then Bitcoin penetration in Nigeria is about to take a new shift and that is a wonderful news for us. The business account is not about bitcoin or any other cryptocurrencies, it is basically about naira and naira only. What I am only implying is that if you want to send naira to someone using the business account, if the person did not use his real name or official business name, the name the person used as the business name will only be seen, not the person's real name. Crypto users may like it because of that, they may want to do transaction with the buyer not knowing their real name.Quote from: Zanab247 on September 16, 2023, 05:16:56 PMThanks for this new update bro, i will do personal research to know more about this new app because most of the exchange app always demand for BVN for registration which is my fear for any new app that is asking for BVN before the process will be successful because, we all no that anybody can use your BVN to gain access to your money at anytime without your permission.That means you can not use it because it will demand for BVN. Only just that you do not have to use your real name and your business name can be anything you call it which people will only see.Quote from: Zanab247 on September 16, 2023, 05:16:56 PMI believe this app will be more secure than OPay, kuda, and palmpay because, many people has loss a lot of money to all those new online app that made people to prefer banks than online banking because if you have seriou issues you can run to the bank for their customercare to solve it for you instantly.I do not think we should see it as secure as Opay, Palmpay or Kuda because it is not also a commerical bank, it is just a payment account. I will still say that Opay and the likes are better for now because it is just still new.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: We get plenty other business account apps way they active, I wan ask before I open this link about their process, dem need anything like KYC for me to carry complete the registration process? I they ask bcuz piple like monipoint and others way person fit use any name open business account they wan use ur BVN to carry link and and things like any ID card way dy recognize by government, so I they ask if this new one also go need make person carry there person ID details carry verify am? If yes then no privacy protection they inside am, as if government wan fine who they behind the account nah just to contact the company to release the person information give dem and eh don finish.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Thanks for bringing such service to our notice. From my research and observation I can see the review of the app is not satisfactory. Non of the reviewers gave a positive response on their part. Though CBN approved the service to be running in the country but those wey dey use am nai go tell the legit or genuineness of the app and the first users never say good about am. But to some extent dem dey keep customers privacy well and that is one of the good part of their service.
